name.value: Mörderische Dinnerparty: Galopp in den Tod

item.description: Murder Mystery game themed around the famous Gold Cup in the Ascot racecourse in the year 1972

After a dark decade of pirating and pillage, the Solar Federation has managed to locate the base of the dreaded Vropt in the vicinity of Mars. With the loyalist forces decimated, the mission to cleanse the pirate menace has been entrusted to a small squadron of four aces: former living legends now turned bounty hunters.

Martian Slayers is a free Print-and-Play cardgame that reproduces a 16-bit shmup videogame from the 90s era! Each player takes control of a ship with 3 lives, 2 or 3 bombs, and some Maneuvers. You are supposed to kill as many enemies as possible while minimizing the incoming fire, because any hit will make our ship explode.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description: A game to confuse the brain. Not so much "say what you see" as follow the rules. Shout out colours from the cards or carry our the moves - but don't get it the wrong way round.

name.value: Extinction: The Last Game They Ever Played

item.description:
What really ended the dinosaurs' reign? Was it a supernova? A giant meteor? Or just mean card play? You'll have a good idea after just one game of Extinction: The Last Game They Ever Played.

It's survival of the fittest in this fast-paced game where everything from thundering meat-eaters to natural disasters are out to make your dinosaur herds extinct.

During the Gene Pool, players unleash sneaky, egg-eating Oviraptors, a dreaded Turannosaurus Rex, and catastrophic events in attempts to make opponents' herds extinct.

Extinction comes with three decks of quality playing cards, a set of ten embossed herd extinction markers, a plastic storage tray and a millenium of fun.

—description from the publisher

name.value: Crisis: The Economist International Money Game

item.description:
Crisis is a board game that was included with a 1990's issue of The Economist magazine.

The game focuses on the international bullion and currency markets.

Each player is dealt a mixed hand of currencies and gold, and attempts - through bluffing and card play - to establish monopolies in one or more holdings.

The game is a mixture of roll and move combined with card play, management and counting.

The game provides rules and board, but the players must provide cards and a die.

There is no designer credited.

—user summary

name.value: The Lion King: Simba's Pride – Hop-a-Croc Swamp Game

item.description:
Join Kiara, Kovu, Timon, and Pumbaa on a challenging trip across moving logs and hungry crocodiles. 
Spin a dial to move 1 to 4 logs ahead or to move one of the movable logs. Travel across the logs until you reach the end, except the movable logs may move you forward, backward or prevent you from moving ahead.

Legion Atlantica is a two player war game set in an alternative history second century CE in which the Roman Empire discovered the New World 1300 years before Columbus. Game turns represent months, hexes are roughly twenty miles across and Strength Points correspond to approximately 500 men. The player who controls their opponent’s capital first or the player with the largest number of city points at the end of the game is the winner.

The Roman Player controls the Invading Roman forces attempting to establish “New Rome” and extend their control over nearby Mesoamerican city states. The Tikal player controls the principle Maya kingdom trying to stop them. Both sides may attempt to conquer or win the allegiance of other Mesoamerican city states that start the game neutral, these include small independent city states as well as larger regional powers.

The game features Leaders who command armies but are also needed to conduct negotiations. Roman fleets and Mesoamerican canoe transports, low levels of transatlantic Roman reinforcements, cities that can be fortified, pillaged or destroyed, slave workers, supply and attrition, cavalry (Roman player only) and human sacrifice (Tikal player only).

By necessity almost all of the forces and characters represented are fictional, however the map is a realistic representation of the actual Mesoamerican terrain and the city states are those that there is evidence for at this time. The game represents the importance of food and river transport to the Maya and the key influence of superstitions and festivals. Celestial markers for the Moon, Venus, Mars and Jupiter are moved on a night sky track causing increasing unrest or even rebellion and changes of allegiance amongst the regional powers and city states, especially when 2 or more markers stack together.

—description from the designer

name.value: ダイスガールズ Track 3 (Dice Girls Track 3)

link.value: ダイスガールズ Track 4 (Dice Girls Track 4)
ダイスガールズ Track 5 (Dice Girls Track 5)
ダイスガールズ Track２ (Dice Girls Track 2)

name.value: ダイスガールズ Track 4 (Dice Girls Track 4)

link.value: ダイスガールズ Track 3 (Dice Girls Track 3)
ダイスガールズ Track 5 (Dice Girls Track 5)
ダイスガールズ Track２ (Dice Girls Track 2)

item.description:
11:59 on the Doomsday Clock. DEFCON 1. Launch codes ready. Silos loaded and ICBMs armed. Nuclear War is imminent. Your president, still clinging to a dwindling hope of diplomacy, deep underground with you and a lucky few, shakes with anticipation. They all look to you. Kill or be killed. Survive. Roll the dice and hope you have what it takes to defend a nation, your country, your home.

11:59 is a 2-Player micro dice game that requires lightning-quick decisions, dexterity and stamina. As a decorated General on the verge of war your mission is to either succeed through diplomacy or destroy your enemy’s bunker and VIPs before your enemy beats you to it. Each General controls two dice and a missile silo full of nuclear warheads while hidden in a bunker. Launch nukes, employ propaganda and fortify your bunker to become victorious. Do you have what it takes to win?

MISSION: You must kill your enemy’s VIPs or collect 5 diplomacy gems.

SETUP: You start the game with 2 VIP meeples, 2 chevron bunkers (stacked) and 1 nuke in the unloaded position (laying on side). The diplomacy gems & extra chevron bunkers are set in the center of the table within reach.

HOW TO PLAY: You will roll 2 dice simultaneously and continuously (in real-time) with your enemy until you complete your mission.

Roll 7 – If you roll 7 you may either earn 1 diplomacy gem (add 1 gem to your side of the table) or rebuild your bunker (add 1 chevron to your bunker stack) at the cost of 1 diplomacy gem (send 1 gem back to the table).

Roll Doubles – If you roll Doubles you may load your nuke (place your nuke in the upright position), launch your nuke (lay your nuke on its side) to remove 1 enemy chevron bunker (send the chevron bunker to the table) or VIP (remove the VIP from play) if no chevron bunkers remain, or employ propaganda (send 1 of your enemy’s diplomacy gems to the table).

Continue rolling until you’ve killed your enemy’s VIPs or acquired 5 diplomacy gems.

-description from designer

A game of precision, skill and silliness! See how steady your drawing hand is with a giant wobbly pen! In A Wobble is a laugh-out-loud drawing and guessing game designed to be played in teams, and is a guaranteed way to get the whole family involved in the fun. Great for parties or family occasions, In A Wobble challenges players to remain steady and draw specific items while their team mates guess what it is though the catch is that all this is done with a giant vibrating pen! So put your artistic skills to the test and see how you handle the wobbly pen, then enjoy the attempts of your friends and family in this fun game anyone can play. The set includes 1 x giant vibrating pen, 1 x paper pad, 25 x cards (featuring 150 x items to draw), 1 x sand timer and full playing instructions.

—description from the publisher

A stand-alone solo/coop pen and paper adventure game based on Greek mythology.
—user summary

Four Against the Titans is a pen and paper adventure game designed for solitaire or RPG-lite co-operative games. Set in ancient Greece in a time of myths and legends, players choose heroes from ten different character types to complete mighty quests and battle creatures such as centaurs, harpies and maenads, all in an attempt to defeat the titans and forestall the destruction of Greece.

Based on the Four Against Darkness series of dungeon delving adventures, Four Against the Titans is a standalone game. You don't require any other rule sets to play this game.

—description from the publisher

name.value: Grendha: The search of lost triumphs

item.description:
Grendha: For Millions of years, planet Meru was the home of the Urs. It started when a passing celestial object sent the Urs fleeing into dark caves. The Light transformed some of them into intelligent beings. Arnoru was the greatest of them.
Arnoru spent years writing down the deepest secrets of creation in the book that came to be known as GRENDHA.
Vishara and Vurthon, the sons of Arnoru travelled far and wide. As they fought their father’s strange creations that brought unhappiness upon the world, they decided that it was time for Arnoru’s reign to end. Vishara and Vurthon returned to the City of Celestial Light and killed their father in a battle that destroyed half the palace. Dying, Anroru released all the knowledge in Grendha. A wave of change spread across the lands. The pages were torn and scattered across time and space, for the final secret of the tome was that once its knowledge was used to the fullest, the book would seek even more… Vishara and Vurthon stood in the ruins of the civilization blaming each other for what had transpired. Then, each sibling carved his own empire, which fractured in time, because without a true leader who could manifest Grendha’s power, there would no unity among the people.

Vishara believed in the destruction of the scattered pages of Grendhaa while Vurthon believed that finding them and recreating the world would bring peace. Thus, there emerged two factions: Hastindra and Thashindha.

Grendha is a 2-4 player strategic war game. This is the quest of four heroes and their warriors to find the lost leaves of Grendhaa. After his demise, Arnoru, who resides in the soul realm, aids the Deva who are allied with Vurthon. Genu is allied with Vishara.

Genu, who are technologically advanced, are allied with Vishara. Vurthon leads the Vurthonians, Vishara is the leader of Visharates, Deva leads Devas and Ondu with their warriors Kondus. The primitive Urs serve both factions Hastindra and Thashindha.

Grendha is equipped with over 400 detailed Miniatures, 136 cards, 520 tokens, 18 dice. The territory cards are shuffled at first to start the game. The warriors can only be deployed with the resources that the player collects with their resource cards. The Resource cards can be collected throughout the game in turns. The power cards can be used to invoke power from Arnoru and Genu. The players have to collect the Leaves (lost pages of Grendha) from the locations mentioned in the Leaf guide card which is drawn each time from the center of the board. There are three types of warriors who have different attack and defend strategies. Each Warrior can move and attack on their own way. The player who collects maximum leaf cards and territory wins the game.
Grendha has been designed with many dark secrets buried within. The game consists of three levels, and you can put together different strategies to win the game in a different way each time.

—description from the publisher

How exciting to be on safari, trying to spot all your favourite animals... but, hang on, one of them has wandered off!
Be the first to spot the missing animal!

The double-sided cards feature two levels of play. Choose the side with 7 possible animals for children or for learning the game, and choose the other side with 12 possible animals for a challenge!

In every card there is one missing animal compared to the key cards showing all possible animals. There is no taking turns, you can take the card if you are the first player to identify that missing animal!

After one of the piles runs out, the game ends. The player that has collected most cards wins the game.

Fun and frantic card game of matching and observation.

Do you speak caveman? No? Well, here's your chance to learn!

There are four pictures in the cards, with four possible background colour. Distribute the cards evenly between players, and if everybody is ready the game begins!

There is no taking turns, you have to find a match as quick as possible! It's a rapid race to get rid of your cards before your megalithic mates!

For example: if a player laid a card and called out "mamu" (that means mammoth), and in his card played the mamu was with blue background, all players would search through their cards looking for a mamu with blue surround. Once a player finds this combination, he can place the card on top of the pile and can call out the next word! Shout out one of the caveman words so that everyone knows what to look for next...

The first player to get rid of all his cards wins the game!

name.value: Robin Hood: Hero of the People

item.description:
Play as Robin Hood and his merry men in this solo card game. As Robin Hood you’ll rob from the rich, give to the poor battle the Sheriff of Nottingham, his goons and recruit your merry men. Increase your influence over the people to gain power and win the game, but be careful, the Sheriff has put a bounty on your head. If it gets too high the people will turn you in for the reward.

Robin Hood: Hero of the People is a solo card adventure. The object of the game is to recruit your band of Merry men consisting of Maid Marian, Little John, Will Scarlett, Friar Tuck, Alan a Dale and Much the Miller. There is also a bounty on your head. During the game the bounty will increase so be careful that it doesn't get too high.

Each turn has 3 phases, Rob the Rich, Action and story Phases. During the rob the rich phase draw 3 cards from the loot deck. These include resources that you will use to complete actions.

During the action phases, play resource cards to recruit characters, decrease the bounty, build your Sherwood Forest camp and buy special abilities from King Richard

During the story phase, draw and resolve a story card. Story cards add extra challenges to players, some you can overcome, some you can't.

Once you have other characters recruited you can swap to take advantage of special character abilities.

Once you have all the characters available and the bounty set at 500 gold or lower, you have won the game. If at anytime the bounty tracker reaches 1000 gold or you play the final story card, you lose.

-description from designer

The irreverence Blanc-Manger Coco now attacks the world of the fans of the imagination and digital culture. You like the Marvel saga and the hugs with our friend Pedobear, the sequences of "0" and "1" make you think of poetry more than arithmetic: La Geekerie is for you!

Mix the cards or not with the other games in the range: you decide.

Contains 160 reply cards and 40 question cards.

The Mysterious Library had a collection of special books. They provided REAL adventures for the readers who became a character of the story. They could train dragons, search for treasures, sail on the Nile, all this for a library fee of a few cents.

One day an inventor came to make experiments with the books: Mr. Mean did awful destruction with his projector blade. In the damaged books the continuity of the story was broken and the adventurers had trapped by them and couldn’t return to reality.

Your mission is to collect all parts of the destroyed books to set the adventurers free. You also have to disarm those projector blades that Mr. Mean activates one by one in the library to save the building from collapsing by the devastating magical power. The mission can be successful only if you all return to your headquarters without any harm. Every member of your team has a special talent which can help you during the game and if you use these talents skillfully, and in coordination, with each other, your mission will be successful!
—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
18-card battle of mechs where the intial draft of equipment and weapons leaves two different mechs to use their tactical prowess to bring the other down.

Print-and-play card game based on the Battletech RPG. Tested, and created, by fans with attention to detail and balancing.

—description from the designer

Fifteen centuries have passed since Jesus descended from his cross, bathed Jerusalem in blood, and conquered Rome. The world has been ruled by inquisitors ever since.

Flame and Cross are symbols of The Holy Office, the institution whose sole purpose is to spread and defend the one and only true faith. But these symbols also contradict each other, for one represents Persian mages of fire, the other righteous Christians who fight them. The struggle goes on.

In this petty world, fear paralyzes the hearts of those who shy away from ruthless eradication of any signs of evil or corruption. This world is not even full of secrets, but it is surrounded by them, wallows in them, and cannot get away from them. Whenever an answer to a question is found, ten more questions appear immediately.

Inquisitor is a detective board game based on the series of best-selling short stories by Jacek Piekara that take you to the grim, fictional world of inquisitors.

Important note: Not any content of the game, neither images, nor the plot or background, is intended to offend anyone's religious feelings as they are merely props of a popular category known as "Religious Fiction".

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Zoo Animals is a memory game for 1-4 players, ages 2-6.

Each card in the deck features a name and picture of a different animal; there is one pair of cards for each animal. Players place the cards face down, and take turns turning over two cards, trying to make a match. Players who make a match collect the pair of cards and try again. The game ends when all cards have been matched, and the winner is the player with the most cards.

The game also features a solvable puzzle on the back of the game cards.

—description from the publisher

Mortem et Gloriam (MeG for short) is a wargame where you take charge of an army from the ancient world - loosely defined as the period before gunpowder and firearms. You command an army of 50 - 100 bases of painted figures, moving them on a table with model terrain that represents a battlefield.

You are the Army Commander and, with your key Sub-Generals, control your army in attempt to smash your opponent. So you could be Alexander with his leading subordinates Parmenio and Ptolemy, or Hannibal with Hasdrubal and Hanno, or Vercingetorix the Gaul with the leaders of the main Gallic tribes, or Ghengis and Kublai .... the choice is yours.

Put simply Mortem et Gloriam lets us become a general in the ancient world.

—description from publisher

As a Free Captain of the Rim you roam the far reaches of space as a trader and mercenary. Secretly though you are an agent of the Intergalactic Council sent on a clandestine mission to explore planets infiltrated by three alien races known as The Cosmic Hegemony who plan to invade the peaceful worlds of Intergalactic Alliance.

Find all their world shattering Super Weapons, using your Combat Skills, Diplomacy, and Super Science, and stop them before it is too late!

Solo game with a 2 player PvP option.

The game uses a bag builder mechanic to add and remove dice from a bag. Cards are played to explore various sectors of space and 6 custom dice are used for combat situations.

Game components: 75 cards, 6 custom dice, 1 player board and 66 wooden cubes.

—description from the publisher

Battle Penguins can be played with 2-6 players in a head-to-head battle to see who earns the most fish.

Each game consists of three rounds of three goals each, and in each round you are vying for the first, second, or third place prize in three of four characteristics: strength, agility, wisdom, cuteness. Each combatant penguin has stats in each of the four characteristics, and you draft your army, then form three groups to battle others at each location. Some penguins have special abilities depicted, e.g., giving presents to other players. The winners receive fish based on the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place prizes.

Whoever has the most fish after three rounds wins.

Power to the Meeple is a complex, euro-styled strategy game where you attempt to become the mayor of Meepletown. The primaries have just ended and up to five candidates must fight to become the winner of the general election. Whether you choose to be a punk, a Democrat, a Republican and Independent or Green party is secondary to how well you organize your campaign and come up with a lean, effective strategy to win the most votes.

Power to the Meeple has three main gameplay phases. First the players participate in an augmented draft where they will be selecting resources. Most resources are just what they are, face value additions to a player's coffers. Alternatively, a player can pick lower valued resources that have abilities attached to them, which brings another balance to the player's strategy. Throughout the draft (which consists of as many rounds as players) each player is required to select one issue card which will stay with the player for the remainder of the game.

The second phase consists of each player, in turn order, deploying their five campaign tokens to the areas of the modular board they want to canvass (Urban, Estates, Eco-Buildings or Suburban areas).

During the third phase, tokens are revealed and the costs of the campaign are paid with the resources drafted earlier. Players who score in the top 3 positions on an area are usually awarded votes or other bonuses. Scores at individual locations are resolved by the key value comparisons printed on the areas, and the tie breakers are done according to who drafted the tie breakers such as Megaphone, Billboard, Scandal or Town Hall.

Once votes are counted, any money earned during that round are counted, players move up on their respective Urban, Suburban, Estate and Eco-Housing tracks, and lastly, discard all unused resources (besides money). All players also keep their issues.

Rounds 2 & 3 are similar to the first round, with the major difference being the advantages each player may have gained in the previous round.

After 3 rounds the players resolve any pending end of game awards or penalties for the last bit of votes and a winner is declared.

-description from designer

Mechanica Inc. will make the world spotless with their Tidybots: ambitious vacuum robots made for global DOMINATION cleanliness! Humans are messy. It’s time they got some help!

Build the best Tidybot factory and ship out as many Tidybots as possible to prepare for (the definitely harmless) OPERATION CLEANUP. The player who has sold the most money worth of Tidybots wins!

Mechanica is a game of tile-laying and engine building. Each player buys puzzle piece-shaped machines and slots them together to form their factory. The different machines all improve the Tidybots your factory can make: building new Tidybots, upgrading them, copying them, and more. There are many strategies for putting your machines together, and everyone has fun trying to build the perfect factory!

Players compete to buy the best machines for their factory at the best prices while running their factories, shipping out Tidybots for profit, completing specialty bot blueprints to fill their vaults with money, and turning the rotating shop wheel.

—description from the publisher

name.value: ダイスガールズ Track 5 (Dice Girls Track 5)

link.value: ダイスガールズ Track 3 (Dice Girls Track 3)
ダイスガールズ Track 4 (Dice Girls Track 4)
ダイスガールズ Track２ (Dice Girls Track 2)

item.description:
Vancouver Buses is a roll and move game in which players take on the roles of bus drivers travelling around Vancouver. The first player to complete a circuit beginning and ending at the Kootenay Loop exchange wins.

The game was developed by the Vancouver Environment Education Project at the University of British Columbia to familiarise six to ten year old children with the Vancouver transit system.

—user summary

SHARPEN YOUR SWORDS. READY YOUR SPELLS. GATHER YOUR ALLIES.

The ruthless Queen Domianne rules the kingdom of Astelia with an iron fist, but an ancient prophecy has emerged which threatens her reign. The adventure starts in your humble village and eventually leads to the seat of Domianne's power, the peerless and ancient Tower of Greylock.

Adventure Tactics: Domianne's Tower is an encounter-based, campaign-driven, cooperative deck-builder. Begin your journey as one of 5 Basic Classes and battle your way through a branching campaign where you choose your own path in an attempt to overthrow the evil Queen Domianne. With each encounter, you will level up and unlock over 15 Elite Classes, adding new actions, equipment, and abilities.

Will your team find the right combination of Classes and powers in time to stop Queen Domianne? Let the adventure begin!

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Jazzy Pips is a quick, cooperative dice game played in real-time for 3 to 6 players.

You’ve just formed a jazz band! It won’t be easy though. You know your instrument well, but you need to get to know the other musicians you’re playing with. This is the fun of joining a band! With practice, coordination, and the right tempo, you’ll be pulling off a memorable set at the local club in no time!

In Jazzy Pips, each player, or Musician, must work together to overcome Song Cards by using your dice and making quick decisions at the same time. If you complete the Finale, you win! Be careful though, as the clock is ticking, and your dice are limited!

—description from the designer

Speedy Towers is a light, fun, tower-stacking dexterity game for the piecepack.

Players create towers by stacking tiles and coins on top of each other in real time. Build your tiles and coins the fastest to win.

—description from the designer

Reel Masters is a 1-8 player tabletop fishing game. Move your boat, choose your lure and cast your line in hopes of hooking the monsters! Once you hook a fish, roll your dice against the fish to determine who is stronger. Pull hard enough and you can land the fish and earn a chance at cash for powerful upgrades.

Reel Masters has 5 species of game fish commonly found in lakes throughout the United States. This unique game truly captures elements of the real life experience.

Compete in multiple game modes with teams, solo or co-op. If your boat has the most total weight at the end of the game you win! The board changes every time you play and with multiple ways to play, Reel Masters is sure to bring fun to the table.

Good Luck and Tight Lines!

—description from the publisher

Persist is a card game that helps women laugh at the ridiculous role assigned to them in the game of life. The double standards. Being told to smile by strangers. Mansplainers and manspreaders. Unsolicited questions about family planning. Not to mention all the ways women are doomed to fail at living up to culture’s standard of womanly virtue and grace. We know we sweat, we don’t glow.

Persist calls bullsh**. By asking women, their friends and allies to put all the cards out on the table—by being real, Persist invites women to laugh, learn from each other, connect meaningfully… and get up to fight another day.

How to Play Persist: Be the most persistent by earning three cards of the same life value (career, health, leisure, or relationships) to achieve a milestone. Collect three milestones to win.

Cards fall under six categories of gameplay: truth, would you rather, trivia, sharing, roadblocks, act it out, and the occasional wild card. Each category requires a different kind of action for the player to perform individually, with others, or even the whole group. Once played your cards may not be safe! Other players may steal your cards if they are going after the same values. This is where things get fun!

—description from the designer

Goblin Derby is a racing game for 2-4 players. The first player to finish 3 laps around the dangerous and haphazard track is the winner.

Before the race starts players must first scavenge parts from the junkyard to build their, often wacky, vehicle. Then, after assembling their monstrosity, players roll dice to move their cart along the track.

Watch out for the other players, they will try anything to win from ramming you to throwing rocks to shooting rocket propelled goblins.

—description from the publisher

Players take the role of businessmen during the 13th through 16th century in coastal Europe. They can explore the seas and new lands, establish trade routes with foreign villages, gain influence in government through bribes, fight naval battles, trade shares of stock in maritime and colonial companies, engage in piracy, and trade government bonds. They will also compete with 2 NPC factors, the mainland Europeans and the moneylenders.

SHARES OF STOCK
The stock market system is pretty standard. Companies have 10 shares each and the player that owns the most shares controls the company. However, share price is not impacted by buys and sells, but only value of the company. One key difference in this to most stock market games is that not only can players own shares of stock in companies, but other companies and governments can own shares of stock as well. For example, if a government owns majority of shares in a company the player that controls that government then manages the company. It adds an additional dynamic.

COMPANIES
Companies can build trading vessels that allow them to explore the sea and try to find overseas villages to trade with. They can also buy bonds released by governments. In the Colonial Expansion they can also build factories (old term for trading posts) in newly discovered lands as well as explore land and attack the villages. Companies do not start with any money, so they need to raise investments from players, governments, and other companies (or borrow from the moneylenders).

PORT CITIES (GOVERNMENTS)
Port cities are controlled by a magistrate. Players can become magistrates by bribing to gain prestige in the port city. Port cities are able to construct warships. Magistrates can also decide which companies can build vessels in their port city, as well as determine any tax on incoming trade brought by trading vessels. Magistrates can also ban the moneylenders to forgive all debt related to the magistrate, but this will make the moneylenders unavailable for the rest of the game to them.

EXPLORATION
The map is almost completely undiscovered, and as companies, governments and players move their watercraft into unknown territory 1 of 3 things can happen, 1: they discover empty water 2: they discover land, sometimes with a native village and sometimes with out 3. they run into a storm and sink. As all this happens map tiles are placed.

STORMS
After a storm initially sinks one watercraft it roams around randomly for the rest of the game at the end of each turn, and if any watercraft come in it's path they are sunk.

MONEYLENDERS
The moneylenders are the international banking community and are extremely important in the game. Players and governments start out with very limited funds, so the moneylenders are almost always needed. This mechanism is unique, and different than almost all other banking systems in games. The moneylenders themselves have limited funds, but practice fractional reserve banking. This means they lend out more money than they have, so it is possible that they will go under if other entities are unable or refuse to pay debts.

COMBAT
Combat in the game is very simple and based on dice rolls. Warships are the most powerful and vessels are weak. In the piracy expansion the player can also purchase pirate ships for the purpose of plundering cargo, the strength of pirates are in between warships and vessels. Harbours can also be blockaded by watercraft.

BONDS
Governments can release bonds to raise funds. Companies, players, and other governments can invest in these.

MAINLAND POWER
At the beginning of each turn the mainland power may attack a random port city. The mainland power represents mainland Europe. Tribute can be paid to avoid a possible attack. The mainland power may become powerful, but can also be reduced to nothing.

TRADE
The trading mechanism is both simple and the main way to generate wealth. Trading vessels transfer numbers that represent cargo back and forth from overseas villages to port cities. The method is light, and the math involved is very easy.

WINNING THE GAME
The final score is based on final wealth. The score of the mainland power and the moneylenders is also included, so players can very well lose to these NPC entities.

—description from the designer

Jumble Jam is a family card game for 2 to 5 players, where each player takes the role of a grandchildren worker for their grandma during a day at work!

The business has been running smoothly for decades, being passed down from parent to child. Will it remain the reference bakery of the city, or will the grandchildren’s chaos and unrest finish off the successful family business?

The game objective will be complete the largest amount of clients orders or complete the necessary clients orders to win a game. First of all, we'll need to get the desserts that have just come out from the kitchen by placing ours tokens before our friends! All of you play with the same desserts so try to be the one who get it first!

Our clients are hungry! So complete clients orders for win points, but take care of your grandma! (who is always watching you and don't want to waste food!).

The first who reach the necessary amount of complete orders or have the largest amount of complete orders win the game!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Are you a Star Wars expert? Can you identify the difference between Episodes 4-6 & 1-3? Can you remember specific scenes from Episode 7: The Force Awakens? Travel to a galaxy far, far away and test your Star Wars knowledge to see if you are a force to be reckoned with. With 500 questions to answer, it's great for the whole family, whether you want a quick game on the go or to spend some time seeing how much you really know! With a Top Trumps twist at the end to test your memory, can you remember what you learned just moments ago?

Key Features


 Quizzical Star Wars fun with a Top Trumps Twist
 Entertaining educational card game loved for bringing your favourite Star Wars characters to life including questions on Yoda, Darth Vader and Luke Skywalker
 500 puzzling and captivating questions that will test your knowledge and memory on the Star Wars Saga
 Easy-to-carry plastic case means there are no limits on gameplay
 Prepare to outsmart your opponents, discover new and exciting facts and duel your way to becoming the Top Trump


—description from the publisher

Sjónarspil is an Icelandic family and party game. Players get cards with adjectives and must choose the cards that best fit their opponents. Who in the group is the nerd and who is the helpful one? There is no correct answer, as players get more points the more players choose the same adjective. Great game for your group of friends, as the rules are simple, playing time is short and everyone acts at the same time - no wait for others.

—user summary

Vintage family game suitable for people of all ages, playing individually or in teams.

A parlour party game, where players give answers or replies to puzzle type topics - as yet cannot give a date for it (suspect it may have been published around the 1950's, maybe even earlier?).
 Contains:

1 x Question / Puzzle ring-bound booklet - 48 pages of different categories/topics

1 x Solution / Answer ring-bound booklet - 48 pages

name.value: Hispánica: The Conquest of the History of Spain

item.description:
In Hispánica, The Conquest of the History of Spain, there are battles, conquests, betrayals, pacts, knowledge tests and many more emotions. Share your passion for history, have fun and learn with more than 220 characters and historical facts that, from prehistory to the Constitution of 1978, will be parading during the game.
Is a game of strategy and knowledge that brings together characters and historical facts and offers players the possibility of conquering Spain.

With 128 characters, 64 relevant events and more than a thousand historical references, Hispanica intends to give a turn of the screw to historical games to bring them closer to those interested in History and the gamers. It is a game designed to learn from scratch or reaffirm previous knowledge of History.

—description from the designer

Players control krakens trying to reclaim stolen treasure from the ships of vile pirates. Each round, players assign krakens to ships, strengthen them with more tentacles (whose power is secret from the other players) or play cunning kraken tricks on their opponents. Eventually the krakens fight each other to decide who will face a pirate crew and attempt to win back the stolen treasure! Whoever gains the most treasure wins the game and is crowned The Kraking for good!

—description from the publisher

name.value: Pour Taste: The spin it, mix 'em, drink up game!
Probieren oder Verlieren: Drehen, Mixen, Trinken
Slechte Smaak: Het draai het, meng het & drink het spel

item.description:
In the hilarious Pour Taste game, players choose 6 ingredients (ingredients not included) and fill each cup with one of them. Then, each player takes a turn spinning the spinner. The spin will tell the player which ingredients to mix up -- or whether to choose another player to drink, steal chips, or go bankrupt. Will the drink taste ok or totally gross? It's up to the player to decide whether or not they will drink up. Every time a player drinks from a cup, they earn a chip. If they decide not to drink the concoction, they lose a chip. The first player to get 4 chips wins.

—description from the publisher

This is a DotA(Defense of the Ancients)/LoL(League of Legends) like boardgame which be sold only in China. In the game, players are divided into two teams to compete with each other. They can move on the hexagonal grids, play cards and use their Transformer heroes' unique powers to win an advantage over their opponents. And complete the mission to win the game.

—user summary

Welcome to Rolling Orchards, a 2-player game of growing apples and pumpkins at your personal orchard. Turn them to pies and cider to accumulate more points than your opponent. Make the most out of your resources as the season could be over before you know it.

Rolling Orchards utilizes a dice placement mechanic where players select dice from a pool and place them in turn on action spaces. The number and color of the die determine the benefit gained from that space.

Third Place finisher in the Roll and Write Global Jam 2018!

—description from the designer

A 2 player chess derivative type game where players roll dice and set up Fortifications to gain control of and dominate the battlefield. Players will be able to obtain Supplies to aid their endeavors as they both vie for the top.

Each player controls one of four Armies which each consist of 7 different pieces (each Army differs in type) that can be used for tactical thinking, critical math skills for younger children, and a simple-but-fun and straightforward gameplay.

Suitable for ages as low as 8+, and the game comes with:

 14 polyhedral dice
 10 colored six-sided dice
 2 white six-sided dice
 9 Supply sticks
 sheet of felt
 rule book
 piece of merchandise
 game map




Players take turns moving their Armies across the board and attacking each other and each other's Fortifications as they vie for last man standing status. Player polyhedral dice start on their highest numbers and are reduced through battle until they are wiped from the board. Fortifications include: Outposts, Bases, and Forts, each with differing ranges and providing different advantages/disadvantages. Supplies include: Lapis Slabs, Hemp Stacks, Blood Vials, Gold Ingots, and Lavender Sprigs.

Can be played on the provided game map, or on any chess/draught board. Complex enough for adults to lose themselves playing for hours while still simple enough to appeal to children. Makes a perfect gift for the board gamer friend/significant other in your life!

—description from the publisher

Smash City is the action-packed game of Kaiju combat! Toss your giant monster dice at your foes to perform devastating attacks! Crush cities and spread fire, electricity, poisonous gas and radiation! Throw cars and destroy tanks! Inflict maximum carnage like a true Kaiju!

Players must have good aim and a deft hand as they roll their monster dice into the city, knocking down buildings and attacking anything within range. You might even be able to throw cars at your foes!

Each of the four Kaiju has special powers and each favors a particular energy type. Use these to crush your foes and smash the city!

Players gain SMASH! cards as they destroy the city and will have to use their cards and powers to full effect if they hope to overcome their foes and be the victor of Smash City!

—description from the publisher

item.description:
In 6 nimmt!, you want to score as few points as possible. To play, you shuffle the 104 number cards, lay out four cards face-up to start the four rows, then deal ten cards to each player. Each turn, players simultaneously choose and reveal a card from their hand, then add the cards to the rows, with cards being placed in ascending order based on their number; specifically, each card is placed in the row that ends with the highest number that's below the card's number. When the sixth card is placed in a row, the owner of that card claims the other five cards and the sixth card becomes the first card in a new row.

In addition to a number from 1 to 104, each card has a point value. After finishing ten rounds, players tally their score and see whether the game ends., i.e., whether someone has at least 66 points. When this happens, the player with the fewest points wins!

6 nimmt! works with 2-10 players, and the dynamics of gameplay change the more players that you have. One variant for the game has you use 34 cards, 44 cards, 54 cards, etc. (instead of all 104 cards) when you have three, four, five, etc. number of players. This change allows you to know which cards are in play, thereby allowing you to track which cards have been played and (theoretically) make better choices as to which card to play when.

6 nimmt! 25 Jahre includes 28 additional cards to be used in a new variant. The game now lasts only two rounds, and at the start of play each player receives three special cards. Just before you have to place your number card in a row, you can choose to play one of your cards, with these cards opening a fifth row, moving a previously placed card to a different row, inserting one card between two others, allowing up to six cards in a row instead of five, blocking a row, replacing the card you played, and more.

After all number cards have been played, players tally their scores, keeping any unplayed special cards, then shuffle the number cards and begin a new round. At the end of the second round, whoever has the fewest points wins.

item.description:
The Awkward Storyteller is a straightforward party game for creative people. Players have to think in original twists an plot lines for their story, which they make up as they go along, for the entertainment of the other players and anyone else who is listening.
The game begins when a player (the Storyteller) selects a Story Card and reads out the caption upon it, which will be the first line of a story that has yet to be created. The other players then ask the Storyteller creative and difficult to answer questions and play a letter or word Question Card. The Storyteller must develop his or her story ad hoc. This must be done using the specific word on the Question Card in the answer, or beginning the answer with the letter featured on the Question Card, depending which type was played.
Players then have an opportunity to challenge an answer that they feel doesn't make sense, and all players would then vote to validate or discard an answer. If an answer gets discarded, the Storyteller's turn ends.

Whilst primarily designed as a party game for fun, answers can be awarded points if players wish to keep score. Once everyone has been the Storyteller, the player with the most points would win.

Pacific Throat Punch is a double-blind wargame simulating the conflict between the Empire of Japan and the Allied Powers from Pearl Harbor to mid-1944. Both players move units on their own maps. When units enter unoccupied or enemy-controlled areas, they are revealed and placed on a combat tile. While sea and air combat are critical, the only way to drive an opponent from a territory is through the use of ground forces.

Please note that the artwork is unfinished and is for personal use only as it contains some material borrowed from the internet.
